cause.description:
Public Knowledge is a group of lawyers, technologists, lobbyists, academics, volunteers and activists dedicated to fortifying and defending a vibrant information commons.
1. Intellectual property law must strike a balance between the interests of creators and the public.
2. The "end-to-end" architecture of the internet must be preserved.
3. Competiton, choice, and fairness must be required in the technology marketplace.
4. The public must have a voice in the formation of international intellectual property policies.
cause.mission: defend your rights in the emerging digital culture.
cause.name: Public Knowledge
